episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the surprising difficulty the creator of Space Invaders has with his own game, a Cold War spy's unconventional communication method, peculiar laws in 1930s Yemen, and a humorous fact about a tourist attraction in France. The hosts delve into these facts with their usual blend of humor and curiosity, providing fascinating insights and anecdotes along the way.

facts.fact: The guy who invented Space Invaders really struggles to get past the first level of Space Invaders.
During the Cold War, there was a Soviet spy in London who contacted his handlers by throwing a copy of Men Only magazine over a garden hedge.
In 1930s Yemen, it was forbidden to walk backwards or to give a horse a human name.
On the official tourist website of the Mont Blanc area of France, you can buy an excursion into Pussycanyon for 69 euros.
